title: IIT BHU MUN
about: IITBHU Model United Nations (MUN) is one of the most extensive MUNs conducted in the spiritual city of India, Varanasi. The conference has undergone stellar growth since it's inception attracting participation from 22+ countries and 7000+  delegates across its 11 brilliant editions. The 11th edition of the Conference was organised in collaboration with UNIC, New Delhi, under the patronage of UNESCO-INCCU. The Honorable Prime Minister along with some highly distinguished personalities like ambassadors and high commissioners of India also endorsed IITBHU MUN with an inspiring message. Being in the middle of the country's Cultural Capital with its spiritual diversity amidst Asia’s largest residential university, IITBHU MUN has been an ideal location for the conglomeration of passionate debaters and leaders from all over the world to promote diplomacy, advocacy and public speaking among young minds. The Secretariat extends you a cordial invitation to participate in the 12the edition of the IITBHU Model United Nations Conference 2023 which will be organised between 29th September 2023 to 1st October 2023. With eminent guests, stellar Executive Boards, ignited young minds, and exhilarating debates, the upcoming edition promises to be the best yet. The Secretariat is committed to providing you with the best MUN experience and a lifetime memory possible in the holy city of Varanasi.
legacyText: IITBHU Model United Nations has had a quite fruitful journey since its inception in 2012. The conference has hosted about 7000 delegates over 11 incredible editions. It has collaborated with premier institutions such as UNIC for India and Bhutan, New Delhi and has been supported by the UNESCO-INCCU via patronage. The 2021 edition of the conference marked yet another milestone when IITBHU MUN went international and hosted participants from 22 countries, this conference is also  endorsed by the Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi.The previous edition of the conference was endorsed by a quartet of Indian ambassadors to four distinct nations and delegates from 22 countries took part in the conference.IITBHU Model United Nations is counted among the top MUN conferences in India. It has been over a decade since IITBHU MUN set the ball rolling and now it has come a long way with more than 7000 delegates from more than 22 countries discussing their views and ideologies on the pious grounds of Varanasi. The 11th edition of the Conference was organized in collaboration with UNIC, New Delhi,  under the patronage of UNESCO-INCCU.  IITBHU MUN was humbled by endorsement from the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India who appreciated the efforts put in by pupils to decipher the events going on in the world at present and work together to come up with solutions. Our conferences have graced many renowned personalities including Dr. Ajay Kumar, the former Defence Secretary of India.

testimonials.name: Yuvraj Singh
testimonials.review: As it was my first MUN I was quite nervous at first about the preparation and procedure of a MUN. But with a amazing pool of EB members and a outstanding Vice-Chair Mohil Mehra. I had a fruitful experience.

testimonials.name: Purvi Agarwal
testimonials.review: It was an amazing experience being a fresher. Hat's off to the EB's for their patience and support and kudos to the secreteriat!!

testimonials.name: Seth Christopher B Mendenilla
testimonials.review: Salute to IITBHU MUN Secretariat, BOD, delegates around the globe and to everyone behind the success of this MUN.

testimonials.name: Habiba Rasooli
testimonials.review: The sessions were well organised and managed. IITBHU MUN was very productive for me.

testimonials.name: Kevin Maina
testimonials.review: Have you been in a place that felt like a fresh breath of air, filled with excitement and an aura of positivity from the committee heads to the delegates in attendance? This was IITBHU MUN for me!

testimonials.name: Susmit Shivashish Pandey,
testimonials.review: My experience at IITBHU MUN was really great, the EB members were extremely supportive. I learned a lot from the committee and I would like to thank everyone for helping out whenever necessary.

questions.question: Who can register?
questions.ans: Anyone undergoing formal education is eligible.

questions.question: Is there an age restriction for a delegate?
questions.ans: Yes, you should be 15 years or older.

questions.question: Do I need prior experience to register?
questions.ans: No prior experience is necessary to register for the conference.

questions.question: What committees are being simulated?
questions.ans: AIPPM, JPC, UNFCCC, UNHRC, UNCSW and G20  alongside the International Press.

questions.question: Is prior experience needed for any of the committees?
questions.ans: Delegates with prior MUN experience will be given preference for the Crisis Committee. No prior experience is required for the other committees.

questions.question: For how many committees can one apply?
questions.ans: Can apply to maximum 3 choices for committee preference.

questions.question: When is the conference?
questions.ans: The Conference will be held between 29 September-1 October 2023. Save the date!

questions.question: How will the conference be conducted?
questions.ans: IITBHU MUN 2023 will be conducted offline at the IIT(BHU) Varanasi campus.

questions.question: What will be the accommodation arrangements for delegates?
questions.ans: Students would be provided with accomodation in nearby hotels. Details will be released soon.

questions.question: What is the dress code for the conference?
questions.ans: Formal attire is strongly recommended but not required.

committees.title: JPC
committees.data: The Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) is a specialized investigative body in the Indian Parliament, mandated to examine significant issues like policy matters, financial misconduct, and legislative concerns, ensuring transparency and accountability in governance.
committees.agenda: Deliberation on economic inclusion of refugees, with a focus on internally displaced people
committees.title: UNFCCC
committees.data: In order to address the urgent problem of climate change and devise worldwide policies to lessen it's effects the United Nations Framework Convention of Climate Change (UNFCCC) came as an international platform
committees.agenda: Assessing the impact of climate change on the Small Island Developing States(SIDS).

committees.title: UNODC
committees.data: The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) is a global leader in the fight against illicit drugs and international crime. UNODC is mandated to assist Member States in their struggles against interrelated issues of illicit trafficking and abuse of drugs, crime prevention and criminal justice, international terrorism, and political corruption.
committees.agenda: Revisiting the issue of cross border illicit drugs, arms and human trafficking
committees.title: JPC
committees.data: A specialised committee made up of representatives from both houses of a parliamentary system is known as a joint parliamentary committee. Its goal is to look into and research certain important national issues
committees.agenda: Discussing the socio- economic development in India with emphasis on delimitation and reorganization of territories

committees.title: UNHRC
committees.data: The UNHRC is the intergovernmental body within the United Nations responsible for promoting and protecting human rights worldwide. Its primary function includes monitoring the practice of human rights among the member states.
committees.agenda: Deliberation on the right to life for people living with HIV/AIDS.

committees.title: AIPPM
committees.data: Al India Political Party Meet (AIPPM) is a ground for discussion and debate open to all political parties of India.
committees.agenda: Discussion on ways to mitigate corruption in India with special emphasis on administrative bodies
Evaluating the existing delimitation criteria and suggesting reforms for a more fair and representative demarcation of constituencies

committees.title: BCCI
committees.data: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is the governing body for cricket in India, responsible for overseeing the sport's development, organization, and management. Tasked with promoting cricket at all levels, the BCCI manages domestic tournaments, international matches, and the Indian Premier League, ensuring the growth and success of the game nationwide.
committees.agenda: AUPSC : Rise of Insurgent groups as a detriment to peace and security in the continent of Africa.

committees.title: DISEC
committees.data: Disarmament and International Security, also known as DISEC,is the committee that deals with disarmament, global challenges and threats to peace that affect the international community and seeks out solutions to the challenges in the international security regime .It considers all disarmament and international security matters within the scope of the Charter or relating to the powers and functions of any other organ of the United Nations;
committees.agenda: The situation in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine

committees.title: UNCSW
committees.data: The United Nations Commission on the Status of Women (UNCSW) is the global intergovernmental body dedicated to the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of women. The CSW is instrumental in promoting women’s rights, documenting the reality of women’s lives throughout the world, and shaping global standards on gender equality.
committees.agenda: Women as the drivers of Economic Recovery and resilience with special emphasis on SDG 5 and 8

committees.title: UNHRC
committees.data: The United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) is a key international body dedicated to promoting and protecting human rights globally. It is mandated to address violations, support Member States in upholding human rights standards, and foster dialogue and cooperation on related issues.
committees.agenda: Barriers Aplenty - An emphasis on tariff competitions and the disruption in supply chains

committees.title: GA-LEGAL
committees.data: GA-Legal is a trusted leader in providing comprehensive legal solutions, dedicated to assisting clients with matters ranging from corporate law and compliance to dispute resolution and intellectual property. Committed to excellence and integrity, GA-Legal ensures tailored legal support to meet diverse client needs.
committees.agenda: Discussing the state of rights and privileges of marginalized communities in India
committees.title: UNCSW
committees.data: The United Nations Commission on the Status of Women (UNCSW) is the global intergovernmental body dedicated to the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of women. The CSW is instrumental in promoting women’s rights, documenting the reality of women’s lives throughout the world, and shaping global standards on gender equality.
committees.agenda: Women’s full and effective participation and decision-making in public life, as well as the elimination of violence, for achieving gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls.

committees.title: G-20
committees.data: G20 stands for a group of 20, a committee of 19 nations, and the European Union (EU). Consisting of the world’s largest economies,the G20 fosters collaboration with international organizations to enhance global economic governance.
committees.agenda: Deliberation upon the affects of globalization and capitalism on healthcare with emphasis on private healthcare facilities.

committees.title: IP
committees.data: The International Press consists of the role of joumalists, reporters, and photographers. It is responsible for gathering information, conducting interviews, and producing articles or reports on the proceedings
